author: psuzzi
title: CAGA, a Card Game App Framework
description: The Card Games market is worth billions. How can we increase the number of Card Game Apps on Cardano to enable accessing this market?

f6_assessments.q0:
CAGA is a card game app. This proposal will allow the development of a framework available to the community to build connections with other projects.
The proposer lists several examples of future challenges that may need to be addressed later in order to increase the number of users, like the creation of a channel, develop the legal part since laws are different between states or countries, or create examples to help the Cardano community to connect with CAGA.
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed timeline answer needs to be developed. The answer "November 2022: Project available for download, together with documentation" does not represent a detailed timeline.

The team is well skilled to successfully develop the project and the proposal clearly explains the technical aspects of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The answer to "Please describe how you will measure the progress and the development of the project?" is "The application framework should be available in November". This won't allow the community to follow the progress on this project.

This project already received Funds in the Fund#7 but the Github folder seems empty. It would be interesting to see the progress in this project.

Nevertheless, we can see a clear understandable description of the problems and clear solutions. That is why I am giving 3 stars.

f6_assessments.q0:
While physical card games are played globally (a hundred million USD market), card games on blockchains have not seen a wide adoption so far. The team has identified this problem and is trying to address it with their proposal and idea. 

With their card game app framework, they want to facilitate and accelerate the development of novel card game applications on the Cardano blockchain. With this framework available, game developers won’t need to start from scratch but can directly begin with implementing their ideas. Consequently, the time needed from start to finish (of a card game) could be considerably reduced with this framework and more developers might start building card game applications on Cardano. With a larger variety of fun and exciting games (facilitated by this technical framework) more gamers could be boarded on the Cardano ecosystem. 
Therefore, the proposal very effectively addresses the challenge and could have a strong impact on the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unfortunately, a detailed timeline is not provided in the proposal. The proposal states that the framework will be available in November 2022 but additional information on milestones or other deliverables is not specified. 

The budget plan is detailed, overall reasonable and importantly, working hours are specified. This shows that the team has considered all aspects of the projects. From my experience, the costs for legal advice are underestimated and more funds should be allocated to that. Potentially, the funds allocated for project management could be slightly reduced and reallocated. 

Overall, the team members have backgrounds in engineering, software development, cyber security and UX design. Every team member seems to have a unique skill set that is required and important for the successful implementation of this project. The Github repositories of some of the team members indicate active development and code contributions. 

Thus, it is likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully. However, since a detailed plan and timeline were missing, only 4 stars were given.
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics based on which the progress and the development of the project could be measured are not outlined in detail. Individual developmental updates or reports could be useful to keep track of the progress, but no information is given on that. Furthermore, it is not stated clearly whether updates can be tracked on the team members’ Github repositories or the project’s Github page. This should have been stated more clearly. Additionally, social media channels (e.g. Discord, Twitter) where updates could be shared with the community are not provided. This makes it difficult to assess the progress along the timeline. 

The team states, that the proposal can be considered successful if the framework is used by one or more projects. Given the funds requested, this metric is not really convincing me and seems “not enough”. It would have been better if the team had specified certain user/project numbers that make use of their framework. This would have been a good KPI based on which to measure success since eventually it comes down to how many game developers actually use this framework and benefit from it.

f6_assessments.q1:
The team is extremely talented in the technical side of the project. I believe their position allows them to be confident that they will deliver on the described product. 
However the project has not be properly described nor the timeline of the deliverable are posted. Having only a deadline of NOV-2022 as the final delivery of the proposal. 
Secondly I noticed that the team has received funding in Fund 7 for the same topic. And I have not been able to understand the continuation part for this proposal.

f6_assessments.q2: Most of the fund budget is allocated for man hours for programing. There was no mention of github or opensource the code. It would be a limited effort to audit this project on a weekly or monthly basis. Simply at the end of the project the team will need to deliver the proposal KPIs as stated.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has identified a lucrative market: card games. The solution offered is something that would uplift the gaming ecosystem in Cardano, specifically in the card game genre. If I understand it correctly, it is the architecture/scaffolding for developers to build on top of: matchmaking; sit on table and lock funds; connecting to a Cardano node. There doesn't seem to be anything related to card game specifically so I wonder if it could also be applied for other 'simple' games like chess, checkers, backgammon where two players can add money into the game. This proposal would be very beneficial for the Cardano ecosystem--it'll allow more and more games to be built and onboard a big market.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal seem to be well-versed in Cardano and programming. Their github page shows consistent, although not daily, submissions. The proposal lacks sufficient information on the roadmap. It would benefit from a detailed breakdown of expected timeline of CAGA application framework, concrete application, and documentation. Having somewhat of a social media presence and a platform where other developers can interact with the team(discord for example) could also be cool. Interested developers can stay updated and start building as soon as possible. Giving 3 stars as I feel confident just from looking at the team's background, but cannot judge further as the roadmap is too sparse.
f6_assessments.q2: What is shared in this section is a little too unclear. The proposal may benefit from including milestones and committing to a news source(twitter, discord, or blog) where the community can track the team's progress. Github commits is also valid, thus a github page for the project could be created and included in the proposal. A discord or twitter could also be great as interested developers can contact the team.

solution: Provide a reusable framework to be used for bootstrapping new Card Games.
experience: We're the same team behind Cardano After Dark, a poker game on Cardano. We have experience with UI/UX, Plutus, Project-management, SW Development, and Cardano Architecture. We are also concerned about Open Source and reusability
